alert.note: Alert for Brown; Edmunds; Spink (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 05 at 12:09PM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of east central Edmunds, southern Brown and northern Spink Counties through 145 PM CDT... At 108 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms capable of producing a landspout along a line extending from Verdon to near Stratford to near North Scatterwood Lake. Movement was northwest at 20 mph. HAZARD...Landspouts and winds in excess of 30 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Strong thunderstorms will be near... Mansfield around 115 PM CDT. Warner around 120 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of these storms include Aberdeen, Groton, Mina Lake Rec Area, Bath and Mina. LANDSPOUT...POSSIBLE MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
